Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein's statement by suggesting that he announced the end of the Mueller probe, when in fact he did not make such a declaration.
Understate: The claim understates the ongoing nature of the Mueller investigation and the possibility of future indictments against Americans.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support to substantiate the assertion that the Russia collusion investigation is over based solely on the absence of charges against Americans in a particular indictment.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the absence of charges against Americans in one indictment means that Americans couldn't be indicted in the future.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that Rosenstein's comments were specific to the particular indictment and did not rule out the possibility of future indictments against Americans.
